body_html: One first thing I'd check is that for convolution if NCHW (faster) format or NHWC format is used. To find out the causes of performance discrepancies, you will need to profile Tensorflow and Theano and compare the two in terms of where the time is spent. For TensorFlow, you can use Timeline (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/36123740/is-there-a-way-of-determining-how-much-gpu-memory-is-in-use-by-tensorflow/37931964#37931964) to find out the time breakdown for all nodes/operations in a TensorFlow graph.

body: One first thing I'd check is that for convolution if NCHW (faster) format or NHWC format is used. To find out the causes of performance discrepancies, you will need to profile Tensorflow and Theano and compare the two in terms of where the time is spent. For TensorFlow, you can use Timeline (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/36123740/is-there-a-way-of-determining-how-much-gpu-memory-is-in-use-by-tensorflow/37931964#37931964) to find out the time breakdown for all nodes/operations in a TensorFlow graph.
